intro: Masdevallia oversteegeniana, commonly known as the Oversteegen's masdevallia, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its striking, often colorful inflorescences and intricate, elongated flowers. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, with slender, erect pseudobulbs and linear leaves. Its flowers are highly prized in horticulture for their unique shapes and vibrant hues. Masdevallia oversteegeniana thrives in cool, humid environments and requires specific conditions to bloom successfully.
